intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium commersonii f. verum, commonly known as the true hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is native to South America, particularly Argentina. The plant features basal and stem leaves that are typically lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which attracts various pollinators. This form is distinguished by its more robust growth and fewer flower heads compared to other forms of Hieracium commersonii.
